sense.name: a sheet or leaf of a printed document, e.g., book
sense.commentary: PAGE[+entity][+artifact][+document][+printed][+component][+sheet][+book/+newspaper/+manuscript] Note: implies the sheet is part of a collection of sheets.
sense.examples: He's written a five-hundred-page sequel to his last novel. There's an interesting commentary on the editorial page of today's newspaper. The pages of John's manuscript spilled onto the floor. There are some blank pages at the end where you can write comments and notes. Are you on the same page - I'm looking at the figure on page 24.

sense.name: young male attendant to a medieval knight
sense.examples: The page helped the knight put on his armor for battle. Each knight on horseback was followed by his page, also on horseback.

sense.name: an official messenger or assistant, usually young
sense.examples: The legislator resigned because of inappropriate email messages he had sent to a congressional page. The king's court always had several ladies-in-waiting and court pages in attendance. Sally and her sister both worked as pages in Washington.

sense.name: a child male wedding attendant
sense.examples: The wedding procession began with three flower girls and three pages, all about six years old. Little Johnny is refusing to be a page in his cousin's wedding.

sense.name: an act of calling or summoning someone
sense.examples: Bob left the table at the restaurant to answer a page from his beeper. There was a page for a 'Mr. Jones' over the loudspeaker.

sense.name: section of stored computer data
sense.commentary: PAGE[+quantity][+measure][+data][+stored][+computer] Note: refers to a storage capacity, not to specific information content (see Sense 7) Note: a narrow, technical usage
sense.examples: This underpowered CPU spends most of its time searching through pages of memory. The scroll bar will cause the next page of data to be displayed on the screen.

sense.name: a unit of displayed information on the World Wide Web
sense.commentary: PAGE[+entity][+artifact][+document][+electronic][+unit][+display][+web] Note: refers to digital media content, not a unit of storage (see Sense 6) Note: a fairly recent, but now widely used, sense
sense.examples: Go to the site's home page and from there you can navigate to the photo gallery of the recent conference. Mary doesn't like the layout of these web pages. He put it up on a web page.

sense.name: events, period of history
sense.commentary: PAGE[+expanse][+temporal][+period][+historical] Note: idiomatic usage, usually occurs as 'page of history'
sense.examples: It was an event long erased from the pages of history until now. These entrepreneurs are writing a new page in aerospace history.

sense.name: a state of agreement
sense.examples: The members of his team are not on the same page. I think we are all on the same page with regards to this issue.

sense.name: use someone as your model
sense.examples: Mary told John he should take a page from his grandfather's book. The new coach appears to have taken a page from the playbook of his famous predecessor.
